questions.question: Antonio can help other people deal with violence because:

choices.answer: he grew up without a father
he believes violence can be stopped
he was once a violent gang member
he has experienced violence in his own life

questions.question: To be defiant means to

choices.answer: act without thinking
oppose power or authority
defend personal property
destroy something by accident

questions.question: If a person is an intruder, it means the person

choices.answer: says something that hurts someone else
enters a place where he should not be
trust a person that should not be trusted
takes something that belongs to someone else

questions.question: Positive means

choices.answer: possible
comfortable
favorable
understandable

questions.question: Reaction means

choices.answer: why you think or feel the way you do
what you think or do because of something else
how you look when you do something
what you plan to say or do when you meet someone

questions.question: Revenge means the act of

choices.answer: trading places with someone
running from someone to protect yourself
hurting someone who hurt you
returning something you borrowed from someone

questions.question: violence means physical action that is

choices.answer: rough and harmful
hidden and sneaky
healthy and strong
quick and surprising

questions.question: Which of these is the main theme of the story?(Fear)

choices.answer: Courage can overcome fear.
Bars on windows can save lives.
Silence is often the best reply.
Crime can be stopped with weapons.

questions.question: Which detail from the story helps most to unlock its theme?

choices.answer: Zo's mother works in a grocery store.
Zo is surprised by the strength in his own words.
Zo's father has not visited in three years.
Zo is taller than most kids in his neighborhood.

questions.question: A response means a

choices.answer: duty
reason
reply
challenge

questions.question: How does the title connect to the theme?

choices.answer: It tells about how Zo feels about his father.
It names one of the problem Zo must face.
It describes the video Zo is watching.
It explains why Zo is home without his mother.

questions.question: What is Zo's main problem in the story?

choices.answer: How to protect himself.
How to figure out who is outside.
How to make his house safer.
How to reach the phone for help.

questions.question: At first, Zo is going to open the door for the strangers. Then  he decides not to, Why?

choices.answer: He recognizes their voices.
He is to scared to call the police.
He thinks they will get in anyhow.
He takes sudden control of his fear.

questions.question: How does Zo feel at the end of the story?

choices.answer: Proud of his own strength.
Worried his mother will be upset.
Afraid to be home alone.
Ready to report the problem to the police.

questions.question: What do the photo  captions in this article tell the reader?

choices.answer: a message from the author
the name of the person who took the picture
information about the people in the photos
how the author feels about the people in h photo

questions.question: What is purpose of the section heads?

choices.answer: divide the texts in parts
show the meanings of challenging words
separate the text into columns
give extra information that is not in texts

questions.question: The author uses text features to

choices.answer: make the text more interesting
present information in a way that is easy to understand
help readers see the development of ideas
all of the above

questions.question: Antonio can help other people deal with violence because

choices.answer: he grew up without a father
he believes violence can be stopped
he once was a violent gang member
he has experienced violence in his own life

questions.question: Which word best describes how Antonio feels about his life at the end of the article?

choices.answer: excited about continuing his work
amused by the experience he had
confused about his plans for the future
discouraged by the violence in the world

questions.question: Fear, stereotyping, and bad role models can cause violence.

choices.answer: true
false

questions.question: Which sentence has a comparative adjective?

choices.answer: He is tall and handsome.
My young sister is attending this school.
The red bike was new and shinny.
She is faster at swimming than Marcos.

questions.question: Which sentence has a demonstrative adjective?

choices.answer: We enjoy eating Chinese food.
The loud music didn't let us sleep.
That boy you just bullied is my brother!
We heard a loud bang from the basement.

questions.question: Which sentence has an infinitive adjective?

choices.answer: Several students auditioned for the concert.
The mean bully was suspended for two weeks from school.
Jake bought a bouquet of beautiful flowers for his sick mother.
That answer is incorrect.

questions.question: Adjectives tell how something looks, smells, sounds, feels, or a person's mood.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: Which sentence does not have an adjective?

choices.answer: The blue eyed Husky ran away from it's abusive owner.
My brave small dog barked at the intruder and sacred him away.
The smell of fresh baked cookies taunted my paladar.
You should complete your assignments.
